intro: Lobelia purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks. It has small, heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss, Lobelia purpusii is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
